title: Watch PARADISE LOST Play All Of Draconian Times Live At Maryland Deathfest
description: It's 1995 all over again! The post Watch PARADISE LOST Play All Of Draconian Times Live At Maryland Deathfest appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 9 hours ago
text: Paradise Lost hit the stage at Maryland Deathfest 2025 over the weekend to play their entire 1995 album Draconian Times, and of course there's footage of the entire set. Check it out above thanks to YouTuber RichardMetalFan. Paradise Lost just announced a bunch of European tour dates with Messa, High Parasite, and Lacrimas Profundere as the openers. Those dates come a few months after Paradise Lost embarks on their The Devil Embraced mini-US tour for this May, which takes place between Paradise Lost's sets at Milwaukee Metal Fest and Maryland Deathfest. Tickets are available here. As for the first new Paradise Lost record since 2020, it's done being recorded and is hopefully due out this year. According to guitarist Aaron Aedy in a recent interview with Alejandrosis: "It's not fully mixed yet, but it's recorded." When asked if he could talk a little about how the new record sounded, Aedy declined: "No. It's like opening your presents before Christmas. No, I don't wanna go into the new album too much just yet, 'cause I'll wait to see what it's like when it's mixed. It's almost finished, but not quite." html:
Paradise Lost hit the stage at Maryland Deathfest 2025 over the weekend to play their entire 1995 album Draconian Times, and of course there's footage of the entire set. Check it out above thanks to YouTuber RichardMetalFan.

Paradise Lost just announced a bunch of European tour dates with Messa, High Parasite, and Lacrimas Profundere as the openers. Those dates come a few months after Paradise Lost embarks on their The Devil Embraced mini-US tour for this May, which takes place between Paradise Lost's sets at Milwaukee Metal Fest and Maryland Deathfest. Tickets are available here.

As for the first new Paradise Lost record since 2020, it's done being recorded and is hopefully due out this year. According to guitarist Aaron Aedy in a recent interview with Alejandrosis: "It's not fully mixed yet, but it's recorded."

When asked if he could talk a little about how the new record sounded, Aedy declined: "No. It's like opening your presents before Christmas. No, I don't wanna go into the new album too much just yet, 'cause I'll wait to see what it's like when it's mixed. It's almost finished, but not quite."
